sentence.text: Her thin denim jacket was sodden and clung to her like a wet tea towel .
His hands and fingernails were filthy , his face and legs were covered in muck , his clothes were sodden and he was glorying in the wetness of it all .
His coat was half dry , his hat still sodden .
The jungle dimness closed in like green steam ; his forehead was streaming , his clothes were sodden , the giant trunks were dripping rain .
A grey drizzle enveloped the city ; where there were trees , sodden leaves choked the drains and made the pavements dangerous .
We went to the nearest pub in our sodden clothes and reflected on our great holiday .
Ideally this area should have a tiled floor that can be easily swilled down , plenty of hanging space for rainwear , drying racks for sodden clothing , a wash basin and a lavatory .
Becoming embarrassingly aware of the awful smell emanating from her sodden clothing , she closed her eyes in defeat .
Fen paused in his ministrations and without turning a hair stripped off his own sodden clothing .
When I looked carefully I could see lots of orange fragments scattered over the sodden grass and glistening brown earth of the field .
A big grin appeared at the door , followed by the rest of Nigel , his trousers sodden to the waistband .
She gave a great gasp of anguished amazement at the sight of the drowned rat of a boy standing before her , the rain pouring off his sodden hair to run in rivulets down his pale face .

We followed him across the street and down crumbling cement stairs into a fetid basement that stank of excrement , a place two feet deep in sodden papers , envelopes , parcels and stained government forms .
Behind him the tartan curtains of the drawing room framed a view of ten yards of sodden lawn and a curtain of heavy rain .
A large sodden island of reeds lay out in mid-stream like a moored barge .
She untied the knots and removed the saliva sodden strip of cushion covering from his mouth .
What I most relish is the thought of me , eight hours through the treatment , rushing blindly to a meeting at the BBC , hair sodden , stinky and moving around of its own accord .
Now that plants in containers can go in at any time when the ground is not frozen or sodden , many gardeners opt for the spring or early summer .
Scraps of paper , previously sodden , begin to stir in the gutters .
Water had dripped on to the paper so that it had become sodden and merged with the lettuce leaves .
Across the field the bloom of the cherry tree , under which they had sat that morning , hung sodden and spoiled .
Pascoe sighed as he took his sodden riding mac off the radiator .
The gravel was carpeted in bright green moss and leaves lay sodden and dark under the shrubs .
The first half was played in a torrential downpour and both teams did well to keep their feet on a pitch which rapidly became rain sodden and slippery .
